book_name: An Elegant Puzzle - Systems of Engineering Management - by Will Larson.pdf
summary: Migrations are an essential tool for managing technical debt and achieving long-term capacity in engineering systems. While they come with inherent challenges, a well-defined playbook can facilitate effective migrations. The process involves three phases: de-risking, enabling, and finishing migrations. Proper de-risking ensures that all teams are on board and confident in moving forward. Creating self-service tooling and empowering teams will aid in successful migrations, while recognition at the end of the process boosts morale and motivates participation. Embracing this structured approach can lead to a significant reduction in technical debt and an increase in overall system capacity.

slides.section_body: Migrations serve as a necessary mechanism for managing technical debt within growing systems. The trade-off for short-term contributions is more capacity and effectiveness in the future. Companies must grapple with the complexities of executing migrations at scale, often leading to a reluctance to prioritize them.
slides.quote: Migrations occupy the awkward territory of reduced immediate contribution today in exchange for more capacity tomorrow.

slides.section_body: Scheduling migrations can be contentious, especially when larger systems make them more expensive. As technical demands grow, teams often find their resources fully consumed by migration efforts, leading to stagnation and technical debt.
slides.quote: Many midsize companies have a long queue of migrations that they can’t staff.

slides.section_body: The first phase in a successful migration involves de-risking, which requires thorough documentation and team collaboration. Iterative design and feedback from challenging teams are crucial to validate the migration before proceeding.
slides.quote: Effective de-risking is essential, as each team participating is making a bet on your ability to deliver.

slides.section_body: With the solution validated, it's time to develop tools that simplify the migration process. Automating the easiest parts and providing documentation will enable teams to proceed confidently, reducing the overall migration cost.
slides.quote: Spending an extra two days intentionally improving your tools can save years in large migrations.

slides.section_body: Clear and intuitive documentation empowers teams to successfully navigate the migration process. Continuous refinement of instructional materials based on team interactions will lead to greater efficiency and effectiveness.
slides.quote: Documentation and self-service tooling are products that thrive under the same regime.

slides.section_body: Completing a migration entails ensuring 100% adoption of the new system. Start by enacting changes that prevent new code from being written to the legacy system, ensuring that teams focus their efforts on the new approach.
slides.quote: Stopping the bleeding ensures that instead of falling behind, you are making progress by default.

slides.section_body: Establish mechanisms that keep teams informed about migration statuses. Management must prioritize migrations, as teams often lack motivation without leadership support.
slides.quote: Giving wider management context around migrations is essential for prioritization.

slides.section_title: Addressing the Long Tail of Migration Work
slides.section_body: Migration does not end with initial adoption; the long tail of uncompleted tasks remains. The team must engage directly with the challenging tasks to ensure all aspects of the migration are thoroughly executed.
slides.quote: Getting to 100 percent will require the team leading the migration to dig into the nooks and crannies themselves.

slides.section_body: While ongoing migrations should be acknowledged, the majority of recognition should occur at their successful completion. Avoiding incomplete migrations helps mitigate technical debt and positively reinforces efforts.
slides.quote: Celebrating migrations is crucial, but recognition should focus on their successful completion.

slides.section_body: With effective strategies for running migrations, teams can significantly reduce their technical debt and increase capacity. Embracing migrations as a structured process promotes long-term health and growth for engineering teams.
slides.quote: Embrace the structured approach to migrations for a healthier, more scalable engineering future.
